title: NASA’s Newest Ocean Mission Takes Flight
summary: After nearly nine years of planning, preparation, and even once being slated for cancellation entirely, NASA’s Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) Earth-observation mission lifted off from Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station on February 8, at 1:33:36 AM. This nearly billion dollar mission represents almost a decade of work, with the goal of revolutionizing our understanding of Earth’s dynamic oceans.

title: AI spurs space sector innovation
summary: For space companies, the benefit comes from pairing generative AI with more traditional machine-learning algorithms and computer-vision models.

title: Daily Telescope: A bright nebula in a one-horned constellation
summary: The nebula can be found in the constellation Monoceros.

title: Small launch companies seek niches to compete with SpaceX rideshare
summary: Small launch vehicle developers are working to carve out niches in a market for smallsat launches that is increasingly dominated by SpaceX’s Transporter rideshare missions.

title: NASA Launches PACE to Advance Knowledge of Ocean-Atmosphere Interactions
summary: Early this morning NASA launched the PACE satellite to advance understanding of the oceans, the atmosphere, and how they interact. The Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud ocean-Ecosystem satellite’s launch today is the […]

title: Falcon 9 launches PACE Earth science mission
summary: A SpaceX Falcon 9 placed a NASA Earth science satellite into orbit Feb. 8 on a launch that was the first of its kind for the U.S. government in more than 60 years.

title: BlackSky inks $50 million deal to supply imagery services and satellites to Indonesia
summary: BlackSky will work with Thales Alenia is support of the Indonesian Ministry of Defense

title: ESA Astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti to Lead Agency’s LEO Cargo Return Initiative
summary:
European Space Agency astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti has announced that she will be leading the agency’s team responsible for implementing its LEO Cargo Return Service initiative. The initiative was first announced in May 2023. Its aim is to support the development of a commercial cargo transportation service to and from low Earth orbit, offering resupply capabilities […]
The post ESA Astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti to Lead Agency’s LEO Cargo Return Initiative appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Japan funding water-based satellite propulsion upgrade
summary: Japan has awarded Tokyo-based small satellite thruster developer Pale Blue a grant worth up to $27 million to upgrade its water-based propulsion technology for larger spacecraft.

title: ArianeGroup prepares to ship Ariane 6 maiden flight rocket to Kourou
summary: The combined Ariane 6 launcher task force, consisting of ESA, CNES, and ArianeGroup, has reported on the progress of Ariane 6, the steps to launch, and the beginning of stage shipments to the launch site.
